intro: Hermbstaedtia capitata, commonly known as the Cape rose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a perennial shrub that produces showy, pink or red flowers in clusters at the top of its stems. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for coastal gardens. Hermbstaedtia capitata is also valued for its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators.
